Posted: January 23, 2015
												With Worms Revolution being the first Worms game I actually sat down and played since the awesome Worms World Party, I was a bit sceptical at first because the little bit I saw from the 3D Worms Games in between didn´t really click with me. This scepsis was enforced when I was greeted with the most clunky menu design I ever had to witness ... so much clicking and so confusing at the same time. Even when you got into it, it´s still a bit of a chore, escpecially in Online Play, wchich would really benefit in a better and more clear system to get games easily going. This, however, is my only big grasp with WR since the remaining game turns out to be quite excellent. I quite enjoyed the new game mechanics as in the water and the physics objects, which give the game a really nice twist. The weapons are awesome as usual with some cool new stuff, especially in the water department. The often critisised ninja rope has been changed a lot but once you got used to it it handles just fine, only different.Also, the new worms classes, while they don´t feel that special at first, actually develop a lot of depth and strategy once you learn their uses. I also enjoyed the single player mode very much. The campaign is pretty challenging and the enemy AI has a near perfect hit rate sometimes, but this can always be overcome with the right strategies. In total with the DLCs there are over 70 missions, which is a lot and should keep busy for a while. So all in all, I´d definately recommend WR. Make the menus better, and therefore have easier access to multiplayer matches and you are nearing the perfect worms experience.

Posted: September 20, 2014
												Worms Revolution is an amazingly fun game with a satisfying campaign, but an extremely hilarious online. Best with friends, the online multiplayer supports up to four players with customizable gamemodes and characters! Each weapon in the game is specifically designed for optimal carnage and just plain fun. Destroyable landscapes and a 2-D astetic provides a platform like no other (besides previous Worms games), in which you can punch, poke, bomb, shoot, push, hit, and just plain blow up your friends in amazingly addicting ways. Would Recommend. 8/10 Stars.

Posted: November 26, 2015
												It's worms! You know the drill! Good chaotic fun for everyone! (and I do mean everyone. I swear, despite being a more experienced player than my friends, SOMEHOW we never manage to end a game of 16 worms with more than 1 worm left standing. Somehow always gets but-clenchingly close at the end. The game is a roller coaster powered by epic grenade tosses, misscalculations, and spectacular fails)If you're deciding which of many worms games to purchase, I suggest looking up the weapons lists. That's about the only change between the last three worms games (and even then, worms keeps about 80% of weapons between all games the same.) I'm happy because this one includes the Sentry Gun. Big difference from previous worms games are the worm types, which change things up and adds a little extra variety, but not so much that it makes this a difinatively superior or inferior game compared to other worms games.

If there exists DLC with even more weapons and tools, lead yourself to a financially secure state and purchase this game! Lots of fun!

												Worms Revolution is a simple game. Using an expanisive arsenal of weapons, you kill worms until your worms are the last ones standing. It's a really nice game to play casually with friends, or to have in the background while you talk about other things over Skype. With 4 friends however, things can get pretty chaotic. With the proper people of course. Don't play with buzzkills. I wouldn't pay full price for this game unless you're the last person that needs to get it for your group  of 4 to play. My only real gripe with this game is the controls. They can be a tad frustrating. I recommend switching or at least checking the rebind menu.

												Ностальгии кусок. Как показали Worms Reloaded, возвращение в 2Д не обязательно залог успеха. Не могу объяснить, что было с ними не так, но играть в них было скучно и не было ощущения, что это те самые червячки. Revolution же, напротив, погружает нас в ту самую атмосферу, что была в Armageddon или World Party. Всё то, за что мы любили червяков осталось на месте. Нововведения включены так органично, будто всю жизнь там были, просто их никто не замечал. Новая графика, дающая таки ответ на вопрос о том, а где, собственно, воюют червяки. Фишки с физикой, которая не кажется неуместной. Это всё погружает в детство настолько, что оторваться практически невозможно. 10 из 10, ГОСПАДИ, 10 ИЗ 10!!!!111

Posted: December 28, 2015
												Played with a friend and we were both reduced to one brave worm each. A fated 1v1 was about to unfold. It was my turn, and I had a sure victory with the rocket launcher aimed at his worm that would undeniably kill if it gets shot with a direct hit. But the button configuration on the keyboard is a bit challenging to get used to. Space is to used to fire an item and L-Shift is to jump. The exhilaration from the guaranteed victory clouded my mind on the controls. I pressed L-Shift instead of Space to fire my weapon, and jumped to my imminent death straight into the bottomless water pit.10/10 would press the wrong button and jump into water again.

Posted: December 27, 2015
												Only get this game to play with friends. It's fun to goof around. The weapons are silly and the worms are funny.BUT there's one glaring flaw. The single player has a forced tutorial that is long, slow, tedious, and painful. There are occassional bugs, like constant jumping or being unable to aim that requires you to restart. I've only ever had this happen during the singleplayer too. This makes the forced tutorial even worse, and I actually haven't gotten to play any of the actual campaign because I'd rather rip my eyes out than finishing that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. It should be skippable, it isn't, and the devs stand behind making an unskippable terrible tutorial because they must just not want you to enjoy  their game.

												Worms RevolutionAhh, Worms. The classic war game between friends. Worms is a really fun game to play if you have a small group of friends (2-4 people). It's super fun to go on every once in a while to have some fun, laugh and destroy your friends. Posted: December 25, 2015
												The game is excellent! The thing I liked the most in this version is that developers added water. So now you can literally flush your opponent.Graphics is perfect. Nice single player compaign. No lags! This game runs without lags even on my small 1.6Ghz 2000RAM laptop!But not all the things are perfect. The community in this game is not quite friendly. You may be kicked from lobby 10-20 times before you can play a normal multiplayer game. Looks like most of the players does not speak english, which is definitely bad.Also, the multiplayer features such as "Quick Match" does not work on practice. Simply because noone plays them.In addition, players can simply quit or leave the game and spoil the game for other players. Besides all the negative sides of the multiplayer I definitrly recommend this game. It is worth it. If you have friends that already have this game - then the problem with the multiplayer eliminates itself. :)

												While this game gets harsh reviews from goons who do not actually own it or have not played it, it is the best Worms game since Armageddon. The forced tutorial is pretty weak but it is a solid Worms game once you get past that. The Mars and Funfair DLC are worth it with a few extra weapons in each, but the Medieval DLC seems half-baked. Also, turn off the subtitles.

Posted: December 4, 2013
												This game is worth playing just for the multiplayer. It's great to get four friends together, and then ruining that friendship with grenades, or turrets, or water balloons, or air strikes, or mines, or concrete donkeys, or even meteors. The only problem I have with the game is the AI, regardless of what difficulty you set them to, every shot they take is either a complete miss, or an impossible trick shot.

Posted: December 4, 2013
												Don't show PETA. Fun weapons and surprises in this game's matches. Fun game to play with friends. You get to learn a lot about someone in this game.

												Really reminds of Worms: Armagedon in terms of graphics. I liked the new concept of interference with the objects stuck in the ground (lighteners, water glasses, etc.), but I was put off by the "worm races" and lack of backrounds. Overall, worth playing.

Posted: October 17, 2012
												I don't think they can perfect on the original formula any further. Three things were all it took: 2.5D graphics, different classes for even more variety and more humour which is certainly achieved with Matt Berry guiding you throughout the campaign. AI is a stupidly good crack shot but makes it all the more rewarding for winning while all the bad shots online make you point and laugh.

Posted: August 2, 2015
												I love this game, the dialogue is witty and fun, the customization is interesting, the gameplay is just as fun as it was back in 1995, a truly wonderful multiplayer game... Just note, the Bots are ridiculously good. As in, they will perform trick-shots almost every turn, and will always hit their target, one even made a shot that I pretty much thought was impossible, where it managed to fit a Grenade through a hole, just as wide as the grenade itself. As in, a single pixel up, or down and it would have bounced. These guys are absolutely insane. The only times they did miss, gave the impression that they were just humouring me, and wanted to try to balance the match more in my favour.But the multiplayer cannot be faulted.
